Posts.Content: Traci-----TripNeg wrote: Hi Ladies, I don't know if I should be doing this or not..... But, we just lost a sister named Stacey. I'm so upset. I didn't even know her. On the Chemo: Before, During & After thread....Jeremy has told us that his 34 yr old wife has passed away after being dx in May of this year. He has a link to a YouTube video of her and it just tore.. me.. up. Anyway, I sorta screamed on that thread and I feel bad. I was hoping that you guys would go to that thread and say something nice and make up for my ranting. She was too sweet. And way too young. I hope I'm not upsetting anyone by posting this. Traci Trip Neg BRCA + If I never look behind me, my troubles will be few. Supertramp. Dx 2/12/2007, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IIIB, Grade 3, 0/14 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Our Newest Angel, Pixiedust Traci-----TripNeg janie44

Posts.Content: Traci-----TripNeg wrote: Hey girls, just wanted to let you know that us May chemo girls are among other life changing things...planning a trip to Vegas!! Woo Hoo! I spent a little time tonight going back and seeing who had posted on this thread before but who we hadn't heard from lately and so here the list goes! (in no particular order and cap inaccurate) NESSAO1, SASERBICKI, PNPMARY, KIMVIDITO, LOULOUBELL, MAGGIE26, SWIMFAN, SUSANMARY, DBBIEK, SAMMIEKB, PNPMARY, UNCANCALLMERED, MMILKO, KKJ, SDASTARFISH, SAMMIEKB, KPUNKINFISH, B445, DEBBIEK, INMSHOES, GRACIEM2007, PAMLIGHT2, SASERBICKI, KIMVIDITO, AIMSTER1123, IDAMARIA, SHERRY35, JAYANANDA, WILDFLOWERS, ALIEIRE, LOULOUBELL, NOSURRENDER (although, we know where you are!~) MARYIMH, JLG55, SYLAYNE (SHEREE) WEDBIZQUEEN, SYLAYNE, KATYMOM, CRYSTALCAT, AZWILLO, ALLGONE, IWY, SUNSHINE123, AZWILLOW, LUCKY1, BERNADINE, ALIEIRE, JUDYWI, SYLANE, ALIEIRE, CRYSTALCAT, INMSHOES, CYCLE PATH, NEOPAT, MARIIMH, DEBBIK, GRACIEM2007, HLREEH, IDAMARAH, DEBBIK,  BEEMARK, JEANIO-2007mAY09, JENJEN68, and those of you I forgot....remind my chemo brain and I am deeply sorry. Please check in with us!!!!!!  You don't have to go to Vegas although hello....fun, fun, fun!! I went back through the posts and it would be cool to know how you are doing. Hugs!!!! Trip Neg BRCA + If I never look behind me, my troubles will be few. Supertramp. Dx 2/12/2007, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IIIB, Grade 3, 0/14 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Traci-----TripNeg wrote: Hi Ladies, A dear friend of ours that hasn't been on the boards for awhile, recently found 3 new lung mets on her most recent scan. She's had lung mets for two years. I can't remember what tx she has been on (imagine that) but, she emailed me and said she would love any info I can get from you guys. So, please post what treatments you are aware of so she can run them by her Onc. Thanks ladies, Hugs, Traci Trip Neg BRCA + If I never look behind me, my troubles will be few. Supertramp. Posts.Content: Traci-----TripNeg wrote: Hey Everybody, I hope everybody is doing o.k.... Out of curiosity....who has gained weight with chemo? When I was diagnosed on 2/18/07, I weighed 127 lbs. I just had blood work today and I had to move the thing to the 150 mark. Argh..........my stomach is so fat! And, it doesn't seem like I've eaten anymore than usual, less in fact, throughout my treatment. Of course, I am not as active as I used to be but.... good grief! Does anybody know of any appetite surpressents you can take without "feeding" the cancer? Again, I hope everybody is doing good. Hugs, Traci ps Anybody talked to Cynthia in the last few days??? Trip Neg BRCA + If I never look behind me, my troubles will be few. Supertramp. Dx 2/12/2007, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IIIB, Grade 3, 0/14 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Traci-----TripNeg wrote: With the help of Dana, 'wingsofhope', I just got off the phone with Ellen's husband. Ellen has had a real rough time since her surgery in March and is now is a nursing home being cared for. He told me that she was able to read, and so I'm asking everybody to once again pour on some love and go buy some cards. He mentioned how much she loved this site. I feel so guilty that I did not reach out sooner. Please PM me for address. Thanks everybody, Traci Trip Neg BRCA + If I never look behind me, my troubles will be few. Supertramp. Dx 2/12/2007, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IIIB, Grade 3, 0/14 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: EGAL - More cards needed please!!! Traci-----TripNeg GracePang

Posts.Content: Traci-----TripNeg wrote: It is with a very heavy heart that I tell you guys we have another angel. Kathy. Her name on here was Stage4. Our friendship on this board developed into a regular email and phone friendship. I hadn't heard from her in a couple of weeks and I just called to talk to her and her husband told me that she passed away last week, Nov 20th. This was one of her last posts: when is enough enough? Add your Comment to this Conversation stage4 Or User since: 30 Aug 2005 112 Comments stage4 Need your help and advise... when is enough enough.. by that I mean at what point do you stop chemo? I've been on one chemo after another for 3 1/2 yrs ,with one break during which I had 33 radiation. I had one 12 week break after doxil about ruined my ability to walk. this week has been another rough week, Im going at noon today for chemo. I have to take shots or my counts wont hold up even during my break my counts never came up that to me meant my body is wearing out. How long can you do this stuff before it is actually doing more harm then good? I keep doing it because I scared of dieing and knowing that I'm on my last chemo I can do makes it harder. I m sorry is this post is all over the place but thats exactly how I'm feeling this morning.. I want to live but I'm so tired of the fight. Tired of waking up every morning in pain, and tired because I cant sleep well. I'm scared of the next scan (next week) and scared of the next week dealing with the after effects of the chemo which is getting worse every week. I hurt my wrist 2 months ago and its still not healed, I have to wonder if its the chemo that keeps it from healing, xray and mri made no mention of cancer in my wrist. I just wonder how many of you out there have been none stop chemo for this long or longer how do you keep up, what am I doing wrong?  I get tired of people saying you look wonderful considering what your going threw... I guess they could say wow you look like sh@#$  LOL anyway thanks for hearing me out sorry about the spacieness.  I feel better already just venting this out but it is a serious question. thanks As long as I have the energy I WILL continue to fight I am so sad. I'm scared too. The picture is of her and her 20 year old son. Hugs, Traci Trip Neg BRCA + If I never look behind me, my troubles will be few. Supertramp. Dx 2/12/2007, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IIIB, Grade 3, 0/14 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Another Angel.....Stage4.....Kathy.. Traci-----TripNeg Calico
